subject: Re: [junit] NEW Object instance
msgSnippet: ... Is the answer by definition? You either get an object or you get an exception. I don t bother testing whether new succeded in producing a non null
messageBody:
On 5/5/06, jason r tibbetts <tibbettj@...> wrote:
>
> Kamal Ahmed wrote:
> > Hi,
> >
> > How can we verify, using JUnit if an object is really created, if a
> "new"
> > operator is used to instantiate an object.


Is the answer by definition? You either get an object or you get an
exception. I don't bother testing whether 'new' succeded in producing a non
null object. I test if the object that is created is in the state I expected
it to be in - ie via its getters.

Mark


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
